CatDescriptText: Mrs. Mae McClure, cashier wrapper, 2515 Elba St., was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 26, 1959, pg. A1, with question: "Do you believe in divorce even though most religious groups frown upon it, and some actually ban it except under very extenuating circumstances?" answer reads: "Yes. It is better to be away in peace than to be around in mental anguish and to lose your soul."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mae McClure wearing dark textured button down dress with collar and double strand beaded necklace, standing outside of Jenkins Arcade, Thrift Drugs and Kappels stores in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
